channel.title: Comments on: Monday Go Meditation: Game 60

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Thanks Molokai! I've been tinkering with the review over time, so glad to hear that the stream of consciousness is actually something that's working! Be sure to let me know as time goes on whether I'm headed in the right direction as I try to keep improving the reviews. Thanks for your support!
item.content:encoded: Thanks Molokai! I’ve been tinkering with the review over time, so glad to hear that the stream of consciousness is actually something that’s working! Be sure to let me know as time goes on whether I’m headed in the right direction as I try to keep improving the reviews. Thanks for your support!

item.title: By: MolokaiCowboy
item.dc:creator: MolokaiCowboy
item.description: This particular game-study was quite valuable to me, thanks! I really like not only the analysis but the move-by-move 'stream of consciousness' as it were. In chess there is a great book titled 'Logical Chess' (by Irving Chernev) which offers a comment every move. Also seeing the Go terms in context was helpful. Thanks again and hope next week is better for you!
item.content:encoded: This particular game-study was quite valuable to me, thanks! I really like not only the analysis but the move-by-move ‘stream of consciousness’ as it were. In chess there is a great book titled ‘Logical Chess’ (by Irving Chernev) which offers a comment every move. Also seeing the Go terms in context was helpful. Thanks again and hope next week is better for you!

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Of course. It is absolutely essentially not to rely purely on statistics, but it's good to keep in mind when making decisions. That's all!
item.content:encoded: Of course. It is absolutely essentially not to rely purely on statistics, but it’s good to keep in mind when making decisions. That’s all!

item.title: By: afterbreak
item.dc:creator: afterbreak
item.description: I never said bout not using it, just said about ur corner shimari move :D I am 99% sure I was using D15 move years ago, when I was using that tool. I stoped it using after hearing from Guo Juan that I should just play not search stuff on web based on statystic, your own experience is way more important than what other plays, cause u are learning creativity, not just go play.
item.content:encoded:
I never said bout not using it, just said about ur corner shimari move ðŸ˜€
I am 99% sure I was using D15 move years ago, when I was using that tool. I stoped it using after hearing from Guo Juan that I should just play not search stuff on web based on statystic, your own experience is way more important than what other plays, cause u are learning creativity, not just go play.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Just checked the game. It's a completely different fuseki though since Black has alternating 3-4 while in Gu Li's game he had a star point. I wouldn't say that's necessarily an argument for not using D15. Haha.
item.content:encoded: Just checked the game. It’s a completely different fuseki though since Black has alternating 3-4 while in Gu Li’s game he had a star point. I wouldn’t say that’s necessarily an argument for not using D15. Haha.

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I don't think Oren was necessarily saying it's the right answer, but instead was using the statistics as a way of helping show that we need to be more open minded about what options we have on the board. That's all. Haha.
item.content:encoded: I don’t think Oren was necessarily saying it’s the right answer, but instead was using the statistics as a way of helping show that we need to be more open minded about what options we have on the board. That’s all. Haha.

item.title: By: afterbreak
item.dc:creator: afterbreak
item.content:encoded:
well after today there is 21 games with that move:P Gu Li played it today with his game ðŸ˜‰
If u read more about D15 move its a move that you play when youre afraid of playing or didnt want to play against chinese fuseki, and usually u get princered with D12 that make true sword of muramasa(?) – book to read for that “The chinese fuseki – Kato Masao”
sorry but statistic lie, cause there is other kind of trends in go, so does theory of play change a little in fuseki, long time ago like 100 years it changed slower than in last 10 years, you can see a lot of difference in opening and so on

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: I need to use that tool more often. Haha. It definitely broadens my perspective on what strong players considers. Thanks for the data!
item.content:encoded: I need to use that tool more often. Haha. It definitely broadens my perspective on what strong players considers. Thanks for the data!

item.title: By: Oren
item.dc:creator: Oren
item.description: I looked the opening up in a pro database. For move 5... D15 - 1300 Games C15 - 700 Games P17 - 600 Games O17 - 300 Games Play style definitely comes into play, but what I like about databases at time is it is a way to broaden your ideas to what strong players consider. Maybe I took your comment "I had two choices" too literally, but it struck an odd chord when I read it, so I had to comment on that. There are just 20 games with your move to give a comparison, but I think that's enough to say it's playable if unusual. :)
item.content:encoded:
I looked the opening up in a pro database.
For move 5…
D15 – 1300 Games
C15 – 700 Games
P17 – 600 Games
O17 – 300 Games
Play style definitely comes into play, but what I like about databases at time is it is a way to broaden your ideas to what strong players consider.
Maybe I took your comment “I had two choices” too literally, but it struck an odd chord when I read it, so I had to comment on that.
There are just 20 games with your move to give a comparison, but I think that’s enough to say it’s playable if unusual. ðŸ™‚
